newsitem.title: USA: Activision sees growth outside U.S.
newsitem.headline: Activision sees growth outside U.S.

text.p: Activision Inc will generate much of its revenue growth in 1998 from markets outside the United States and from Sony Corp's PlayStation video game console, the software company's chief executive said Monday.

"We feel in fiscal year 1998 the primary opportunity for growth will come from international sales," Bobbi Kotick, Activision's chief executive, said at the Robertson Stephens technology conference in San Francisco.
To fuel international expansion, Activision is looking to make acquisitions in Europe, Kotick said.
Activision, based in Los Angeles, also will concentrate on developing games for the Sony PlayStation video game console, which is expected to dominate the market by the end of the year, he said.

Activision will benefit as the PlayStation's retail price drops, Kotick said. He said there was speculation in the industry that Sony planned cut the price of its flagship video game machine to $99 by Christmas.
